body.section:
You can set the tab order of widgets via the order element in the xml of the part. Nyx adds a JPanel in front of the defined xml, where all controls will reside. The container for the panel however is not yet provided by nyx (at least in the tocure version). Since nyx has no control over the container of the rootpanel and jdk 1.3 has a horrible way of handling the initial focussed field
The nyx rootpanel is used as a reference. After activating all the widgets, the nyx focusmanager is called to set the correct focussed field. This will startup a separate thread which will check when the rootpanel has a parent. If the parent is there, it will add an even to the current swingui to select the next component. The rest of the focusmanagement is triggered by using tab and shift-tab. If no order is specified in the xml, swing will set the order. If you just specify the order of eg 2 fields, the next component after those 2 fields will be the next component on the window, with the exception of those 2 fields. So if you have 3 fields, the specified taborder is field2, field1 (the fields are ordered on the screen as field1, field2, field3) and you are in field2, hit tab, the focus goes to field1, if you hit tab again, the focus goed to field3, and not field2 again.
type - default or custom.
The custom type checks if a field has a value and progresses to the next field (if it is in the order element!) untill the field is empty. If from the fields all fields are filled with a value, it will fallback to the default behaviour.
